en.title: DAL's data modification
en.info_description:
This program is designed to retrieve raw data from the DAL, process it, and generate various files.

   The program produces an initial file allowing human verification of the data for each cow's passage. This initial file contains all the data and is called DB_PAO.csv (1)
   After this verification, the program generates the SICPA file (2) or processes the file by aggregating the drinking data for each day to produce a file suitable for statistical analysis (3). It is possible to delete incomplete weeks (4)

   The 'i' button next to each input field provides a description of the required information and the format in which it should be entered.
en.language_info: Here, you can change the interface language.
en.zip_file_info: Import the file in .zip format containing the raw DAL data using the search button on the right
en.cow_block_info: Enter the birth date range of the block of cows studied in dd/mm/yyyy format
en.IPG_info: Enter the breeding number (IPG) of the group of animals (e.g., FR371783). This corresponds to the electronic tag number WITHOUT the order number (the last 4 digits)
en.nb_sem_info: You must specify the number of weeks (in numbers) that the experiment lasted (the number of weeks in the lactation plan).
en.refresh_info: By clicking this button, the program will retrieve the numbers of all the feeding curves used during the experiment. Each curve must be associated with a feed name, a number of weeks, a theoretical amount of milk per day, and a number of meals, for each week.
en.table_info: You will see a table appear with tabs on the right titled with the curve numbers from the DAL. Each curve must be associated with a feed name defined in SICPA alimentation, a theoretical amount of milk per day, and a number of meals per day, for all weeks of the feeding plan. By default, if no information is provided, the interface retains the theoretical value of zero.
en.aliment_info: You must specify the feed code previously created in SICPA (e.g., PAO-2019-001-AUT corresponding to Univor Premium at a concentration of 115g/l).
en.extract_info:
You must check the types of output files chosen and indicate the extraction location for each one selected :
   1-DB_PAO: database with each drink PAO.

   2-SICPA: data format per drink for exportation to SICPA Influx.db.

   3-Statistiques: data format aggregated per day for statistical analysis.

   4-Semaines compl√®tes: data format aggregated per day with incomplete weeks removed for weekly averages.
en.extract_button: By clicking this button, you will extract the files selected above to the specified location.
en.zip_path_error: The file is not a valid zip file
en.zip_error: The file is not a .zip file
en.num_week: You must enter an integer for the number of weeks.
en.week: You must specify the number of weeks the experiment lasted. It cannot be 0.
en.directory: You must provide the path to a directory.
en.date: You must write the date in dd/mm/yyyy format.
en.date_order: You must provide a start date, then an end date. The earlier date must be before the later date.
en.table_fill: You must fill in all fields in the table with values (integer or decimal numbers with a point as the decimal separator).
